TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpRequestMessage extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HttpRequestMessage class contains headers, the HTTP verb, and potentially data.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an HTTP method and a request <xref:System.Uri>.
Gets or sets the contents of the HTTP message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The contents of an HTTP message corresponds to the entity body defined in RFC 2616.
A number of classes can be used for HTTP content. These include the following.
1. <xref:System.Net.Http.ByteArrayContent> - HTTP content based on a byte array.
2. <xref:System.Net.Http.FormUrlEncodedContent> - HTTP content of name/value tuples encoded using application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME type.
3. <xref:System.Net.Http.MultipartContent> - HTTP content that gets serialized using the multipart/* content type specification.
4. <xref:System.Net.Http.MultipartFormDataContent> - HTTP content encoded using the multipart/form-data MIME type.
5. <xref:System.Net.Http.StreamContent> - HTTP content based on a stream.
6. <xref:System.Net.Http.StringContent> - HTTP content based on a string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources and disposes of the managed resources used by the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to releases only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally disposes of the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of HTTP request headers.
Docs.value: The collection of HTTP request headers.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP method used by the HTTP request message.
Docs.value: The HTTP method used by the request message. The default is the GET method.

Docs.summary: Gets a set of properties for the HTTP request.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Uri> used for the HTTP request.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Uri> used for the HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the request <xref:System.Uri> is a relative Uri, it will be combined with the <xref:System.Net.Http.HttpClient.BaseAddress%2A>.
